definition: complicated/many/in great numbers/abbr. for 繁體|繁体[fan2 ti3], traditional form of Chinese characters
to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil

sentences.english: England under George II was prosperous.
sentences.chinese: 乔治二世统治下的英国繁荣昌盛。

sentences.english: Thank you for contribution to China’s flourishing and prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 感谢您为祖国的繁荣昌盛做出的贡献。

sentences.english: Rising prosperity alone will not placate people indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 仅仅是繁荣昌盛不足以无限期地安抚民众。

sentences.english: Our country is thriving and prospering day by day.
Singing the prosperity of the motherland.
Therefore, putting the "Fu" character up side down is used as a metaphor, showing the arrival of promising spring and auspicious prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 因此，倒贴的“福”字象征着春天和繁荣昌盛的到来。

sentences.english: Our motherlands certainly prosper the prosperous more.
sentences.chinese: 我们的祖国一定会更加的繁荣昌盛的。

sentences.english: Hong Kong's economy has boomed on the back of breakneck economic growth in Mainland China.
sentences.chinese: 大陆经济的强劲增长也带动了香港经济的繁荣昌盛。

sentences.english: Our country is thriving and prospering day by day.
sentences.chinese: 乔治二世统治下的英国繁荣昌盛。

sentences.english: I hope that the country prospers and the people are at peace.
sentences.chinese: 我希望国家繁荣昌盛，人民安居乐业。

sentences.english: The Tang Dynasty was a time of prosperity whenthe pottery was prevailing.
sentences.chinese: 唐代是一个繁荣昌盛的时代，唐三彩就盛行于此时。

sentences.english: I wish you happiness, prosperity and success.
sentences.chinese: 祝中国繁荣昌盛，人民生活幸福美满。

sentences.english: We wish your country evergrowing prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 祝愿贵国日益繁荣昌盛。

sentences.english: People all over the world are hungering for peace, stability, and prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 全世界的人们都渴望和平，安定和繁荣昌盛。

definition: the country prospers, the people at peace (idiom); peace and prosperity
to live in peace and work happily (idiom)
efficient government, people at peace (idiom); all is well with the state and the people
becoming more prosperous with each passing day
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
